verses.roman:
gandha-vastuṣu tad-dehaṁ
nidhāya muni-sattamāḥ
samāpte satra-yāge ca
devān ūcuḥ samāgatān

synonyms: gandha-vastuṣu—in things very fragrant; tat-deham—the body of Mahārāja Nimi; nidhāya—having preserved; muni-sattamāḥ—all the great sages gathered there; samāpte satra-yāge—at the end of the sacrifice known by the name Satra; ca—also; devān—to all the demigods; ūcuḥ—requested or spoke; samāgatān—who were assembled there.
translation: During the performance of the yajña, the body relinquished by Mahārāja Nimi was preserved in fragrant substances, and at the end of the Satra-yāga the great saints and brāhmaṇas made the following request to all the demigods assembled there.
